definition[0]: to attack a place for a long time using large weapons, bombs etc
example[0]: I had been in action, bombarding the Normandy coast.
definition[1]: to do something too often or too much, for example criticizing or questioning someone, or giving too much information
example[1]: The office was bombarded by telephone calls.
example[3]: Today we are bombarded with advice on what to eat and what to avoid.
